alert.note: Alert for Washington (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 05 at 8:33PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...Heavy rain will impact portions of north central Washington County through 900 PM EDT... At 830 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking heavy rain showers 8 miles east of Beverly, moving northeast at 5 mph. HAZARD...Heavy rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Ponding of water on roads and low lying areas along the banks of creeks and streams. Reduced visibility. Locations impacted include... Marietta, Williamstown, Lowell, Macksburg, Lower Salem and Devola. This includes Interstate 77 in Ohio between mile markers 2 and 17. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Excessive runoff from heavy rainfall will cause elevated levels on small creeks and streams.
